page.title: 03Education
page.content: There are three schools in Chew Magna and a pre-school playgroup. In 1883 the infants were moved from the Old Schoolroom to what is now the Primary School and, after it was enlarged, the whole school was transferred in 1894. Until 1958 the village school housed all the village children except those who went to private school. In 1958 a new secondary modern school was built to serve 11 villages. This became a comprehensive school in 1969 and now has about 970 children on the roll. It also has a good academic record and a fine reputation in the area. The third school, a Convent, is housed in the beautiful, old, former Manor House which stands in 15 acres of land. Unfortunately the school, started in 1940, is this year to lose its senior department.
